title.rendered: The Latest Sky TV and Netflix Releases

content.rendered:
As Autumn approaches, so do all the new releases across different streaming services and channels. New seasons, film releases and series have already begun to make an appearance and we have plenty to share with you. Don’t forget we have a range of Sky TV deals for you to check out – including Netflix additions and broadband.

Sky TV

  1. Wonder Woman 1984 (2020)

The long-awaited sequel to the 2017 Wonder Woman, is finally coming to Sky! Set in the 1980’s the second in the Wonder Woman series sees her working at the Smithsonian when she finds herself up against two enemies. Starring Gal Gadot, Chris Pine, Pedro Pascal and Kristen Wiig.

  1. A League of Their Own Season 16

2021 has already been a big year for sport – so August sees the return of A League of Their Own. This season sees a new host in Comedian Romesh Ranganathan alongside Freddy Flintoff, Jamie Redknapp and a range of celebrity quests.

  1. The White Lotus

A new miniseries is hitting Sky this autumn – this comedy drama features Jennifer Coolidge, Connie Britton and Jake Lacy as a group of guests trying to relax in Hawaii at a luxury resort. All is not how it seems when sinister events begin to unfold at the hotel.

  1. Shrek Series (2001 – 2010)

One to keep both the kids and grown-ups entertained! The worlds favourite Ogre and friends are now on Sky TV – so you can enjoy the entire Shrek series from start to finish. Perfect for the end of the school holidays.

  1. The Croods 2: A New Age

New for Sky Store Premiere, this film is available to rent on Sky at the same time it is in cinemas. The prehistoric Croods are back, and this time being challenged by another rival family. Watch Emma Stone and Ryan Reynolds provide the voices to this fun family film.

Netflix

  1. Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw (2019)

This spin off film from the Fast & Furious franchise features Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson (Luke Hobbs) and Jason Statham (Deckard Shaw) as the pair form an unlikely alliance to bring down a new cyber villain. With Fast & Furious F9 now in cinema’s, this is not one to be missed.

  1. Cooking with Paris Season 1

Paris Hilton is back with another reality show this Autumn. This time, she is cooking with celebrity pals in her home. With all things Paris Hilton you can be sure this will be unlike any cooking show you’ve seen before. Perfect if you are looking for something light-hearted and fun.

  1. Fatherhood (2021)

This Kevin Hart film is must-see. Not only does it feature the comical moments he is known for but it is a sweet tale of the bond between father and daughter that is uplifting and inspirational.

  1. Memories of a Murderer: The Nilsen Tapes (2021)

This documentary tells the story of serial killer Dennis Nilson – as he narrates his own life and crimes through a series of chilling audiotapes recorded from his jail cell. Fans of true crime and documentaries won’t want to miss this true story.

  1. Good Girls Season 4

Beth, Annie and Ruby are back for Season 4. This will be the final season of the show which saw two sisters and their best friend get tired of playing by the rules and ending up getting themselves entangled in some rather messy crimes.

If you’re wanting to check out all these new releases, take a look at our range of Sky TV and Netflix Deals!
